instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Random black screen
threads.message: On the bench I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has a strange issue. The backlight flickers and turns off, or stays on. <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> is 3.3V  and <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> is 11V when computer is turned off but when I turn the machine on <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> goes to 7-8V and stays, even if I close the screen down. Does this mean <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> is toast. The backlight will randomly go out, then come back on, then stay off. Can't say I have ran into this issue much.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Random black screen
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> goes to 7-8V and stays"
If you mean <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL>, perfect.

I recommend to test first with known good compatible LCD assembly.
The image still present when backlight goes off?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Random black screen
threads.message: yeah for the most part. It did glitch out once. By that I mean the Apple logo would come up then the screen would blink, then the Apple logo would come back. It did that about 5 times before I tried to shut it down with the power button, which is not working either.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Random black screen
threads.message:
Board goes off, or you can only detect backlight issue?
USB activity still present at that time?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Random black screen
threads.message: I get USB activity because I am booted from external drive. After the initial crash I have not been able to get it to do crash again, just the backlight issue remains. Going to see if I have a test LCD.
